metadata.title: CVE-2021-3682 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the USB redirector device emulation of QEMU in versions prior to 6.1.0-rc2. It occurs when dropping packets during a bulk transfer from a SPICE client due to the packet queue being full. A malicious SPICE client could use this flaw to make QEMU call free() with faked heap chunk metadata, resulting in a crash of QEMU or potential code execution with the privileges of the QEMU process on the host.

criterions.comment: qemu package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
